sentences.sentence: They landed me at Vauxhall, with my heavy iron box, and a friendly policeman as my companion.
A quarter of an hour’s drive brought us to Mrs. Cecil Forrester’s house, and a servant let me in, leaving the obliging( 效劳 ) policeman in the cab.
Miss Morstan was seated by the open window.
The soft light of a shaded lamp fell upon her as she leaned( 倚靠 ) back in the chair, playing over her sweet, sad face, and highlighting( 使突出 ) the rich coils( 卷 ) of her luxuriant( 浓密的 ) hair.
At the sound of my footsteps she sprang to her feet, and her cheeks blushed( 脸红 ) with surprise and pleasure.
“I heard a cab drive up,” she said. “I thought that Mrs. Forrester had come back very early, but I never dreamed that it might be you. What news have you brought me?”
“I have brought something better than news,” said I, putting down the box upon the table and speaking lightly, though my heart was heavy within me. “I have brought you a fortune.”
She glanced at the iron box.
“Is that the treasure, then?” she asked, calmly enough.
“Yes, this is the great Agra treasure. Half of it is yours and half is Thaddeus Sholto’s.
You will have a couple of hundred thousand pounds each. The interest will be ten thousand pounds a year.
You will be one of the richest young ladies in England. Isn’t  it wonderful?”
I think that I must have been rather overacting my delight, and that she detected some insincerity( 不诚实 ) in my congratulations, for she glanced at me curiously.
“If I have it,” said she, “I owe it to( 将...归功于 ) you.”
“No, no,” I answered, “not to me, but to my friend Sherlock Holmes. I could never have followed up a clue( 线索 ) which has challenged even his analytical genius( 才能 ).
As it was, we very nearly lost it at the last moment.”
“Please sit down and tell me all about it, Dr. Watson,” said she.
I told her briefly what had happened since I had seen her last—the discovery of the Aurora, and the wild chase( 追赶 ) down the Thames.
She listened with parted lips and shining eyes to the story of our adventures.
When I spoke of the dart( 刺 ) which had so narrowly missed us, she turned so white that I feared that she was about to faint( 晕倒 ).
“It is nothing,” she said, as I hurried to pour her out some water. “It was a shock to me to hear that I had placed my friends in such horrible danger.”
“That is all over,” I answered. “Let us turn to the treasure. I got permission to bring it with me, thinking that it would interest you to be the first to see it.”
“It would be of the greatest interest to me,” she said.
There was no eagerness in her voice, however. It had struck her, doubtless, that it might seem ungracious( 不礼貌的 ) upon her part to be indifferent( 不关心的 ) to a prize which had cost so much to win.
“What a pretty box!” she said, stooping( 弯腰 ) over it. “This is Indian work, I suppose?”
“Yes; it is Benares metal-work.”
“And so heavy!” she exclaimed( 惊呼 ), trying to raise it. “The box alone must be of some value. Where is the key?”
“Small threw it into the Thames,” I answered. “I must borrow Mrs. Forrester’s poker( 拨火棒 ).”
I stuck the poker( 拨火棒 ) behind the lock and twisted it outward.
The lock sprang open with a loud snap( 啪嗒一声 ).
With trembling fingers I flung back the lid.
We both stood gazing( 凝视 ) in astonishment.
The box was empty!
It was massive, well made, and solid, built to carry things of great value, but it was absolutely and completely empty.
“The treasure is lost,” said Miss Morstan, calmly.
As I listened to the words and realized what they meant, a great shadow seemed to pass from my soul.
I did not know how this Agra treasure had weighed me down( 使焦虑 ), until it was finally removed.
It was selfish, no doubt, but I only realized that the golden barrier was gone from between us.
“Thank God!” I said from my very heart.
She looked at me with a quick, questioning smile.
“Why do you say that?” she asked.
“Because you are within my reach again,” I said, taking her hand. She did not withdraw it.
“Because I love you, Mary, as truly as ever a man loved a woman. Because this treasure, these riches, sealed my lips. Now that they are gone I can tell you how I love you.”
“Then I say, ‘Thank God,’ too,” she whispered, as I drew her to my side.
Whoever had lost a treasure, I knew that night that I had gained one.
It was a long time before I rejoined the inspector. His face clouded over( 看起来忧愁 ) when I showed him the empty box.
The inspector shook his head.
“It’s a bad job,” he repeated, “and so Mr. Athelney Jones will think.”
His forecast proved to be correct, for the detective looked blank enough when I got to Baker Street and showed him the empty box.
My companion lounged in his armchair with his usual listless( 无精打采的 ) expression, while Small sat calmly opposite( 在对面 ) him.
As I showed him the empty box, he leaned( 倾斜 ) back in his chair and laughed aloud.
“This is your doing, Small,” said Athelney Jones, angrily.
“It is my treasure, and I tell you that no living man has any right to( 对...有正当权利 ) it, unless it is three men who are prisoners in the Andamans and myself.
I cannot have the use of it, and I know that they cannot.
I have always acted for them as much as for myself.
It’s been the sign of four with us always.
I know that they would have had me do just what I have done, rather than let it go to the family of Sholto or of Morstan.
It was not to make them rich that we killed Achmet.
You’ll find the treasure where the key is, and where little Tonga is.
When I saw that your launch( 汽艇 ) must catch us, I put the loot( 战利品 ) away in a safe place.
There are no rupees for you this journey.”
“You are deceiving( 欺骗 ) us, Small,” said Athelney Jones, sternly. “If you had wished to throw the treasure into the Thames it would have been easier for you to have thrown the whole box.”
“Easier for me to throw, and easier for you to recover,” he answered.
“The man that was clever enough to hunt me down is clever enough to pick an iron box from the bottom of a river. Now that they are scattered( 分散 ) over five miles or so, it may be a harder job.”
“This is a very serious matter, Small,” said the detective. “If you had helped justice, instead of thwarting it in this way, you would have had a better chance at your trial.”
“Justice!” snarled the ex-convict( 囚犯 ). “What justice! Whose loot( 战利品 ) is this, if it is not ours? Where is the justice that I should give it up to those who have never earned it?
Look how I have earned it!
Twenty long years in that fever-ridden( 热病缠身 ) swamp( 沼泽 ), all day at work, all night chained up in the filthy( 肮脏的 ) prison-huts( 小屋 ), bitten by mosquitoes( 蚊子 ), bullied( 欺凌 ) by the guards.
That was how I earned the Agra treasure, and you talk to me of justice!
I would rather be hanged than live in a prison cell and feel that another man has the money that should be mine!”

article_info.previous: 一定要追上Aurora号！Holmes一行人紧紧相随，步步逼近。最后木桩腿男人和他的野蛮人伙伴终于都现身了，经过一番对峙，Jonathan Small一伙已经插翅难飞，被Holmes他们成功缉拿归案。而后Watson带着丢失了钥匙的宝藏箱去往Miss Morstan的住处。
article_info.share_words: Because I love you, Mary, as truly as ever a man loved a woman. Because this treasure, these riches, sealed my lips. Now that they are gone I can tell you how I love you.

question.cn: 当Miss Morstan看到宝藏箱是什么感受？
question.en: How did Miss Morstan feel when she saw the treasure box?

analysis: 文中描写：“She glanced at the iron box.‘Is that the treasure, then?’she asked, calmly enough. . . There was no eagerness in her voice”因此答案选B。

question.cn: Morstan小姐对于他们的冒险经历作何反应？
question.en: How did Miss Morstan respond to the story of their adventures?

options.cn: 她希望她能够参与到他们的冒险经历中。
options.en: She wished she could have been there with them.

options.cn: 她对那个野蛮人感到非常好奇。
options.en: She was very curious about the savage.

options.cn: 她很震惊朋友们曾置身于那样的危险境地里。
options.en: She was shocked that her friends had been in such danger.

analysis: 文中提到：“When I spoke of the dart which had so narrowly missed us, she turned so white that I feared that she was about to faint.‘It is nothing,’she said, as I hurried to pour her out some water.‘It was a shock to me to hear that I had placed my friends in such horrible danger.’”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 当他们打开箱子，发现了什么呢？
question.en: What did they find when they opened the box?

options.en: The box was filled with jewelry.
Half of the treasure was gone.

analysis: 文中提到：“With trembling fingers I flung back the lid. We both stood gazing in astonishment. The box was empty! It was massive, well made, and solid, built to carry things of great value, but it was absolutely and completely empty.”因此答案选C。

question.en: Did Watson confess his love to Miss Morstan at last?

analysis: 文中Watson说道：“Because I love you, Mary, as truly as ever a man loved a woman. Because this treasure, these riches, sealed my lips. Now that they are gone I can tell you how I love you.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 为什么Jonathan Small没有扔下整个箱子呢？
question.en: Why hadn’t Jonathan just thrown the whole box?

options.cn: 因为他没有想到这一点。
options.en: Because he hadn’t thought about that.

options.cn: 因为这样会更便于他们找回宝藏。
options.en: Because that would make it easier for them to recover.

options.cn: 因为他想要自己收藏那个箱子。
options.en: Because he wanted to keep the box himself.

analysis: 文中Jonathan说道：“Easier for me to throw, and easier for you to recover. The man that was clever enough to hunt me down is clever enough to pick an iron box from the bottom of a river. Now that they are scattered over five miles or so, it may be a harder job.”因此答案选B。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第40天
